_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Reasons for the Buddha laying down a rul: For keeping difficult persons in check and for the comfort of good-hearted mendicants
To prevent those of wicked desires from taking sides and dividing the Saṅgha
The training that Kassapa received from: Setting up a keen sense of conscience and prudence for seniors, juniors, and those in the middle
Paying heed, paying attention, engaging wholeheartedly, and lending an ear to teachings connected with what’s skillful
Never neglecting mindfulness of the body that is full of pleasure
